thread.title: Restaurant inspections: Miami County and Piqua health inspections
thread.title_full: Restaurant inspections: Miami County and Piqua health inspections | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Freelancer
title: Restaurant inspections: Miami County and Piqua health inspections
text:
From Miami County and Piqua Health Department reports:
Veterans of Foreign Wars
Address: 8756 N. County Road 25A, Piqua
Date of inspection: Aug. 17
Violations/comments: Provide metal stem thermometer with a think tip so food temperatures can be monitored. Remember to date all ready to eat TCS foods, i.e. cut lettuce, cut tomatoes, etc., with date opened. Discard after seven days.
Pizza Hut Wing Street
Address: 1631 Covington Ave., Piqua
Date of inspection: Aug. 14
Violations/comments: The metal stem thermometer and “clean” food containers need to be cleaned.
Silver Lake Beach Inc.
Address: 4720 S. Scarff Road, New Carlisle
Date of inspection: Aug. 5
Violations/comments: No items at time of inspection.
Steak & Shake
Address: 1779 W. Main St., Troy
Date of inspection: Aug. 4
Violations/comments: The grouting under dishwasher is very low and holding water/food debris. Maintenance agrees to regrout area to help with odor and gnat harborage.
Sterling House of Troy
Address: 81 S. Stanfield Road, Troy
Date of inspection: Aug. 3
Violations/comments: Observed food debris on the under side of the mixer. Please clean area thoroughly. Mildew growing on caulking on dirty side of dishes in dish room. Discussed options with maintenance to prevent.
Subway Wal-Mart
Address: 1801 W. Main St., Troy
Date of inspection: Aug. 7
Violations/comments: Chicken and meatballs in walk not date marked. Ensure that these items are date marked for seven days and then discarded. Dirty mop water near utensil storage area. Ensure mop water is stored away from utensil storage. Hand wash sink not providing hot water. Repair sink and ensure hot water is working.
The Silver Spoon Factory
Address: 1446 W. Main St., Troy
Date of inspection: Aug. 4
Violations/comments: Satisfactory at time of inspection.
Troy BK Root beer
Address: 2780 Stone Circle, Troy
Date of inspection: Aug. 7
Violations/comments: Observed a pan of shredded cheese in ice bath at 53 degrees F. The ice bath wasn’t touching the pan of cheese to keep food below 41 degrees F. Hamburgers in a pan on top of stove being held at 124 degrees F. Food must be kept at more than 135 degrees F. Observed a working container without a label. Please label all working containers to prevent any confusion or misuse.
Bethel Local High School
Address: 7490 S. Ohio 201, Tipp City
Date of inspection: Sept. 3
Violations/comments: Keep cold TSC foods under refrigeration as long as possible. Only bring out as needed.
Bethel Local Elementary Middle School
Address: 7490 S. Ohio 201, Tipp City
Date of inspection: Sept. 3
Violations/comments: Satisfactory at time of inspection.
Burger King
Address: 1829 W. Main St., Troy
Date of inspection: Sept. 1
Violations/comments: Observed grout that is collecting food residual between tiles. Use a deep cleaning floor product or regrout the floor properly. Observed mop sink with crack in bottom, fix sink properly.
Comfort Suites
Address: 1800 Towne Park Drive, Troy
Date of inspection: Sept. 2
Violations/comments: Cooler thermometer not reading accurately. Repair or replace thermometer. Cooler has a covering on bottom that is deteriorated. Remove covering and ensure it is cleanable.
Covington High School
Address: 807 Chestnut St., Covington
Date of inspection: Sept. 2
Violations/comments: Food service in good operation at time of inspection.
Buffalo Jacks
Address: 1375 High St., Covington
Date of inspection: Aug. 10
Violations/comments: Observed prep cooler holding top section temperature controlled foods for safety at 50 degrees F and bottom TCS feeds at 45-47 degrees F. All TCS foods must hold 40 degrees or below when cold holding. Management is going to time mark TCS foods until issue is fixed. Focus on this critical issue. Ensure all parts of slicer are cleaned and sanitized of food residual. Observed residual on parts. Observed walk in cooler floor with dark build up. Deep clean floor and if it is smooth and easily cleanable resurface floor properly. Felt food residual on handles of equipment. Clean when needed or when required (cooler door handle). Observed water leak under garbage disposal. Fix issue. Dishwasher thermometer is not working properly. Fix issue to ensure dishware is being sanitized. Clean behind sink area of residual on walls. Fix wall next to walk in cooler door. Resurface/secure FRP board properly.
